info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 3:32PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTY THROUGH 400 PM MDT... At 332 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Mesa, or 36 miles north of Roswell, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Chaves County. This includes Highway 285 between Mile Markers 136 and 149. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
